Dialogue.Page: Hm?

DialogueOption.Text: How did you get here?
Feldspar?!
I found something!
See you later.

Dialogue.Page: Well, this place is pretty undiscoverable by default. Did you perchance go into a black hole?

DialogueOption.Text: Uh, I guess? Seems like this place is a solar system cutoff from the universe.

Dialogue.Page: Well no kidding. Say, you're the one with the ship here, so may I ask you a favor?

DialogueOption.Text: Yeah, sure, what is it?

Dialogue.Page: So, long story short, I was whizzing around the outer solar system, when suddenly I crash into some ghostly planet.

DialogueOption.Text: How were you not trapped there?

Dialogue.Page: Well, you see, the back end of my ship got lodged in there, while the front half got sent flying forward. Somehow, I crashed here.

DialogueOption.Text: Okay, so what's the favor?

Dialogue.Page: Get my radio from that ghostly moon. It's urgent.
Oh, right. I spotted a tall tower of unknown height on that gold-looking planet not long ago. That may get you somewhere.

DialogueOption.Text: Thanks.
I already went there?

Dialogue.Page: Feldspar? Haha, that's the funniest thing I've ever heard!
Not really. I've heard it a million times.
Feldpar is my 2nd cousin. We just so happen to look alike.

DialogueOption.Text: Oh.

Dialogue.Page: Oh? Go on, tell me. It just might spark my curiosity.

DialogueOption.Text: I found a Nomai colony on that golden moon.
There was a huge tower on the golden moon.
I found a black hole that takes you to the core of Helioraxia.
The Nomai built some kind of gateway on Zephyria.
I landed on a huge space station.
I managed to land on the Ghost Moon!
Nevermind, I forgot.

Dialogue.Page: Oh, there is? Wonder how they got there.
Probably used it for mining or something.
Eh, who knows? Let me know if you find anything else.

DialogueOption.Text: They did actually use it for mining. So,

Dialogue.Page: Really? Can't imagine how tall it is.
What was it used for?

DialogueOption.Text: Something about a ghost moon and some strange property.

Dialogue.Page: Ghost moon? Sounds crazy. But there has been wandering moon around here.
Wouldn't doubt what the Nomai are saying is true.

DialogueOption.Text: Huh.

Dialogue.Page: In fact, I actually crashed into that ghost moon, or at least I think so.
I was in the outer solar system, so...

DialogueOption.Text: How did you not get trapped?

Dialogue.Page: Oh, you did? Haha, sorry.

DialogueOption.Text: No problem.

Dialogue.Page: Oh really? You can't just fly down there yourself? Why and where would you need a black hole?

DialogueOption.Text: The core of Helioraxia is completely shut off from the world.

Dialogue.Page: Wait... then how did you get... out?

DialogueOption.Text: Uh... Anyways! The black hole was in a building on an asteroid colony. It was to access the Ghost Moon.

Dialogue.Page: Ah, another Ghost Moon predicament, eh? They sure are persistent.

DialogueOption.Text: So,

Dialogue.Page: Gateway? I wouldn't doubt they were trying to leave this place.

DialogueOption.Text: Trying to leave? Leaving is easy!

Dialogue.Page: Easy? Pfft, entering this place is a one-way trip to purgatory!

DialogueOption.Text: What? I can just warp out.

Dialogue.Page: Oh, you can teleport out, but the Nomai didn't have whatever warp tech you have.

DialogueOption.Text: Eh, fair enough. So,

Dialogue.Page: Huge space station? What purpose would a space station have for the Nomai?

DialogueOption.Text: Apparently it was constructed mainly to experiment on...

Dialogue.Page: Let me guess, the Ghost Moon?

DialogueOption.Text: Yup.

Dialogue.Page: Was there anything else there?
Like some kind of clue or what not?

DialogueOption.Text: There was a wall with letters on it. A Nomai also mentioned how he scattered words tied to those letters across this system.

Dialogue.Page: Hmm. Actually, you might be best checking the houses behind me. I think I saw a strange pile of rocks in one of them.

DialogueOption.Text: Thanks!

Dialogue.Page: What!? You managed to do it?
Did you find my radio?

DialogueOption.Text: I sure did. But I couldn't pick it up. It was glued to the ground.
No, unfortunately. I didn't see it anywhere.

Dialogue.Page: Aw, that's too bad.

DialogueOption.Text: Sorry.

Dialogue.Page: Well, thanks for going out to find it anyway.
Even if you couldn't pick it up, I still appreciate you.

DialogueOption.Text: Thanks. So,

Dialogue.Page: Ok, see you around, pal.
